EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────
### Stone Furnace Facility at position (0.0, 0.0)
Consists of:
• Stone Furnace (position: 0.0, 0.0) – Smelts iron ore into iron plates to support crafting operations.
• Iron Chest (position: 1.5, 0.5) – Stores produced iron plates.

### Iron Ore Mining Setup at position (-16.0, -51.0)
Consists of:
• Burner Mining Drill (position: -16.0, -51.0) – Extracts iron ore.
• Burner Inserter (position: -14.5, -49.5) – Transfers ore from the extraction point.
• Transport Belt (position: -15.5, -49.5) – Delivers extracted ore.
• Iron Chest (position: -13.5, -49.5) – Stores delivered ore.
• Intermediate Transport Belt (position: -15.5, -47.5) – Feeds ore to a remote branch.
• Burner Inserter (position: -14.5, -47.5) – Moves ore along the intermediate belt.
• Remote Output Chest (position: -13.5, -47.5) – Receives ore from the remote inserter.

### Copper Furnace at position (-27.0, -60.0)
Consists of:
• Stone Furnace (position: -27.0, -60.0) – Smelts copper ore into copper plates.

### Lab Power Integration System at position (0.5, 2.5)
Consists of:
• Lab (position: 0.5, 2.5) – Processes science packs.
• Offshore Pump (position: -7.5, 25.5) – Draws water; its dedicated connection point (e.g. near -7.5, 24.5) has been targeted during recent manual connection attempts.
• Boiler (Original) (position: 2.0, 17.5) – Was refueled with coal (Step 296) but subsequent reconnection and manual pipeline attempts have left it reporting NO_FUEL.
• Boiler (Repositioned) (position: 10.0, 6.5) – Fueled with coal but remains unconnected due to missing fluid inputs.
• Steam Engine (position: 5.5, 5.5) – Generates electricity; remains not connected (warnings indicate “not connected to power network”, “no input liquid”, and “no fluid present in connections”).
• Multiple attempted fluid network segments – Recent operations included intermediate and direct manual pipe placements (with designated connection points such as (2.5, 19.5) for the Boiler and (3.0, 5.5) for the Steam Engine) that were unable to establish a continuous connection.

### Pipe Production Facility at position (3.5, 0.5)
Consists of:
• Assembling Machine (position: 3.5, 0.5) – Configured for pipe crafting.
• Iron Chest (position: 1.5, 0.5) – Stores crafted pipes.
• Electricity Network – Comprised of small electric poles linking production components.

ERROR TIPS
────────────────────────
• Fluid Connection & Intermediate Node Failures
 - Multiple connection attempts between the Offshore Pump, Boiler, and Steam Engine have failed due to blocked or misaligned connection points and mismatches in expected fluid contents.
 - Tip: Verify that both source and target connection points are clear and that the fluids present (or required) match the target’s expectations before attempting reconnection.

• Pipe Placement Distance Issues
 - Manual placement errors occurred because the target positions were too distant from the player’s current location, triggering “target position is too far” errors.
 - Tip: Move closer to the intended target positions so that the distance is within the maximum allowed range before placing pipe entities.

• Conflicting Entity Obstructions
 - Direct placement of pipes at critical connection points has failed when an entity already occupies the target tile.
 - Tip: Ensure that any existing pipe or object obstructing a critical connection point is removed prior to attempting placement.

• Fuel Insertion Failures
 - An attempt to refuel the Boiler failed due to insufficient coal in the inventory.
 - Tip: Confirm inventory resources (e.g. coal) are available before executing refuel operations.

• Historical API & Placement Pitfalls
 - Repeat issues such as Boiler repositioning failures, “nearest_buildable()” invocation errors, and general API misuse (e.g. invalid calls causing type errors) persist.
 - Tip: Always validate candidate build regions and use defined API functions correctly, ensuring proper entity retrieval and clearance before placement.

NAMESPACE
────────────────────────
• get_entity(entity: Any, position: Any) -> Any  
 Retrieves an entity of the specified type at the given position. Returns the entity on success; raises an exception if not found.

• pipe_entity(pipe: entities.Pipe) -> Any  
 Processes a pipe entity during pipeline connection routines.

• rotate_entity(entity: Any, direction: Any) -> Any  
 Rotates the given entity to the designated direction to correct its alignment during placement.

• insert_item(resource: Any, target: Any, quantity: int) -> Any  
 Attempts to insert a specified quantity of the resource (e.g. coal) into the target inventory. Returns the updated target on success; raises an exception if the resource is unavailable.

Important Variables:
• pump_working (OffshorePump) [Type: OffshorePump] – Holds the working offshore pump entity at position (-7.5, 25.5).
• boiler_original (Boiler) [Type: Boiler] – Represents the original boiler entity at position (2.0, 17.5).
• candidate_intermediate_offpump (Position) [Type: Position] – Candidate intermediate connection point for linking the Offshore Pump to the Boiler (e.g. (-2.75, 21.5) or updated to (-0.4, 19.5)).
• candidate_intermediate_boiler (Position) [Type: Position] – Candidate intermediate connection point for linking the Boiler to the Steam Engine (e.g. (3.1, 13.9)).
• boiler_connection_point (Position) [Type: Position] – Intended connection point for the Boiler’s water supply at (2.5, 19.5).
• steam_engine_connection_point (Position) [Type: Position] – Intended connection point for the Steam Engine’s steam input at (3.0, 5.5).
• pipe_count (int) – Represents the current number of pipes available in the inventory.
• distance (float) – Calculated distance for pipe network segments.
• final_inventory (Inventory) – Snapshot of current inventory item counts after recent operations.
